concepts.name: Graphing Linear Inequalities
concepts.description: Understanding and graphing linear inequalities in one or two variables, including shading appropriate regions of the graph.

concepts.name: Solving Inequalities Using Addition and Subtraction
concepts.description: Techniques for isolating variables in inequalities by adding or subtracting terms on both sides of the inequality.

concepts.name: Solving Inequalities Using Multiplication and Division
concepts.description: Solving inequalities by multiplying or dividing both sides, including reversing the inequality sign when using negative numbers.

concepts.name: Compound Inequalities
concepts.description: Solving and graphing inequalities involving 'and' or 'or' to represent multiple intervals.

concepts.name: Absolute Value Equations
concepts.description: Solving equations involving absolute values by considering both positive and negative scenarios.

concepts.name: Absolute Value Inequalities
concepts.description: Rewriting and solving inequalities with absolute values as compound inequalities, and applying them to real-world problems.

concepts.name: Linear Inequalities in Two Variables
concepts.description: Graphing and solving inequalities in two variables, using shaded half-planes to represent solutions on a coordinate plane.

concepts.name: Real-World Applications of Inequalities
concepts.description: Modeling real-world problems using inequalities and interpreting the solutions graphically or algebraically.

concepts.name: Interval and Set Notation
concepts.description: Expressing solutions to inequalities using interval notation and set builder notation.

concepts.name: Representing Inequalities on Number Lines
concepts.description: Graphing solutions to one-variable inequalities on number lines, using open or closed circles to indicate inclusion or exclusion.
